definition: surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale

sentences.english: Do some critical thinking and write your thesis statement down in one sentence.
sentences.chinese: 做一些批判性的思考，並用一句話陳述出你的論點。

sentences.english: Tailor your presentations; don't be generic.
sentences.chinese: 量身訂做你的自我陳述，不要大衆化。

sentences.english: According to his own testimony, he was 197 years old.
sentences.chinese: 根據他自己生前的陳述來看，這位老人活了197歲。
最後，考慮一下你的陳述。

sentences.english: According to the first paragraph, which one of the following statements is TURE of the SeaFalcon?
sentences.chinese: 根據第一段，哪個陳述是關於海鷹正確的描述？

sentences.english: As the report states, "Among these were five solo divers who could not get help."
sentences.chinese: 根據報告陳述，其中有5個獨自潛水者無法獲取幫助。

sentences.english: A concise, clever, often paradoxical statement.
sentences.chinese: 雋語一個簡明，機智，經常似是而非的陳述。

sentences.english: The priest in the Fermanagh will case in the witness box .
sentences.chinese: 弗馬納的神父站在證人席上陳述。

sentences.english: The document was first reported on Sunday by The Detroit News.
sentences.chinese: 這份陳述首次由《底特律消息》在星期天刊報道。

sentences.english: But that is an odd statement.
sentences.chinese: 但這是一個奇怪的陳述。

sentences.english: It starts with writing or having an effective problem statement.
sentences.chinese: 它是從一個筆頭闡述或者陳述的有效問題開始的。

sentences.english: Le provided a long litany of development problems and challenges facing China.
sentences.chinese: 樂連篇累牘地陳述了目前中國面臨的發展問題和挑戰。
這是黃在報告中的陳述。

sentences.english: Characterized by an authoritative, arrogant assertion of unproved or unprovable principles.
sentences.chinese: 在爭論中作爲前提提出的未經證明的陳述。

sentences.english: This paper expounds the application of the statistical work in the management of coal transportation and marketing.
sentences.chinese: 陳述了統計工作在煤炭運銷管理中的應用。

sentences.english: Do you believe the witness's statement?

definition: to inform/to report/to make known/report/speech/talk/lecture/CL:篇[pian1],份[fen4],個|个[ge4],通[tong4]
conclusion/verdict/CL:個|个[ge4]/to conclude/to reach a verdict
to have sth to do with/to relate to/related to/to concern/concerning
to prove a point/to expound on/to demonstrate or prove (through argument)/proof
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
